fields.title: Jquery
fields.description:
jQuery is a lightweight JavaScript library to write redundant code that utilizes the $ sign which is an alias for jQuery.

jQuery takes multiple lines of code that covers up many lines of code and wraps them into methods that you can call with a single line of code. Moreover, It simplifies myriad complicated things like AJAX calls and DOM manipulation which possess features like CSS manipulation, Event triggering, etc.

Many of the tech giants on the Web use jQuery, such as Google, Microsoft, IBM, Netflix. The jQuery syntax is tailor-made for selecting HTML elements and performing some action on the element(s).

fields.title: Data Structure and Algorithm
fields.description: The data structure is a technique of storing and organizing data in such a way that the data can be utilized in an efficient manner while an Algorithm is a process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations.

fields.title: linear and Non linear Data Structure
fields.description:
What is Data structure?

Data structure is a technique of organizing, managing and storing all data items in such a way that the data can be utilized in an efficient manner and establish relationships among those data items.
They are the building blocks of a program which mainly specifies the following four things:

  • Organization of data.
  • Accessing methods
  • Degree of associativity
  • Processing alternatives for information

 

To develop a program of an algorithm, We should select an appropriate data structure for that algorithm. Therefore algorithm and its associated data structures form a program.

 

Algorithm + Data structure = Program

 

A static data structure is one whose capacity is fixed at creation. For example, array. A dynamic data structure is one whose capacity is variable, so it can expand or contract at any time. For example, linked list, binary tree, etc.

 

In Computer Science, a data structure is designed in such a way that it can work with various algorithms. A data structure is classified into two categories:

1.Linear data structure

2.Non-linear data structure

 

Now let's have a brief look at both these data structures.

 

Linear data structures

A linear data structure is a structure in which the elements are stored sequentially in a contiguous memory location, and the elements lie next to one after another. They can be traversed in a single run and a particular element can be accessed at atime

Examples: Array, Queue, Stack, Linked List.

 

Non-Linear data structures

A non-linear data structure is another type of data structure in which the data elements are arranged in a non-linear fashion. So,  the data elements cannot be traversed or accessed at a time. In the case of linear data structure, an element is connected to two elements, whereas, in the non-linear data structure, an element can be connected to more than two elements.

Examples: Trees,  Graphs

 

 

Linear Data Structure

Non-Linear Data Structure

Definition

In this structure, the elements are arranged sequentially or linearly and attached to one another.

In this structure, the elements are arranged hierarchically or non-linear manner.

Traversal

As linear data structure is a single level, so it requires a single run to traverse each data item.

The data items in a non-linear data structure cannot be accessed in a single run. It requires multiple runs to be traversed.

Arrangement

Each data item is attached to the previous and next items.

Each item is attached to many other items.

Hierarchy

This data structure does not contain any hierarchy, and all the data elements are organized in a same level.

In this structure, the elements are hierarchically  arranged.

Time Complexity

The time complexity of linear data structure increases with the increase in the input size.

The time complexity of Non-linear data structure doesn’t increases with the increase in the input size.

Examples

Arrays, linked list, stack, queue are the examples of a linear data structure.

Trees and Graphs are the examples of a non-linear data structure.

Applications

Used in  developing the software

Used in Neural networks, Artificiak Intelligence etc.

fields.title: Getting Started with Hello World!
fields.description:
To use Jquery, We use  $ , an alias for the jQuery function and namespace.

Syntax:  $(selector).method()

Make a index.html file. It looks like this:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">
        <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
        <title></title>
        <meta name="description" content="">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="">
    </head>
    <body>

        <h1></h1>
        
        <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.6.0/jquery.min.js"></script>
    </body>
    <script>
        $('h1').text("Hello World!")
        //jQuery('h1').text("Hello World!")   
    </script>
</html>

Explanation:

  $('h1').text("Hello World!")   -> Select h1 element and display text as Hello World! using text()

  Instead of $ you can use jQuery to obtain the same result.

fields.title: DocumentReady and Namespace Collision
fields.description:
Document Ready Event

Consider an index.html

<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
    <title>Jquery tutorial</title>
    <meta name="description" content="">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.0.2/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"></link>
</head>

<body>

<div class="container m-5">
    <p class="product">
        <strong> Learn Javascript</strong>
     </p>
     <button class="btn btn-primary" id="btn1">Add To Cart</button>
</div>

</body>

<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.0.2/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script>
<script src="jquery-3.6.0.min.js"></script>
<script>
  $(document).ready(function () {
    $("#btn1").click(function(){
        alert("Added:"+$(".product").text());
      });
</script>

</html>

 

Explanation: 

jQuery click() method in the above example, is inside a document ready event. This is to prevent any jQuery code from running before the document is finished loading (is ready).

For example, there's a p element on the document and you have defined a jquery function for it. What if the jquery function runs before the p element is loaded into the document. So, To prevent this document.ready is a must.

 

Namespace Collision

There are Libraries other than jQuery that uses $ as an alias. This can cause interference between those libraries and
jQuery.To release $ for use with other libraries, we use noConflict() method:
jQuery.noConflict();

You can assign a different variable as an alias for jQuery:
var jq = jQuery.noConflict()

 

Example 1 

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">
        <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
        <title></title>
        <meta name="description" content="">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="">
    </head>
    <body>

        <h1></h1>

        <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.6.0/jquery.min.js"></script>
    </body>
<script>
    jQuery(function ($) {                // DOM is ready
        var jq = jQuery.noConflict();
        jq('h1').text("Hello World!")
    });
</script>

</html>

fields.title: Jquery Selector
fields.description:
There are three main types of selectors in jQuery

    1. Element selector  ->  For selecting element, we just mention the name of element  i.e p ,h1,body,html,div

    2. Id selector  ->  For selecting id, we use a prefix '#'  such as  #name, #id ,#container

    3. Class selector  -> For selecting id, we use a prefix '.'  such as .name, .id , .container

Other selectors

    Attribute Value Selector  i.e  $("[href=’domainname.com’]")

    Indexed Selector  i.e   $("div:eq(1)")  

    Selecting by Possession of Attribute  i.e $("[href]")

Jquery Selector

Meaning

$("*")

Select all the html elements.

$("div")

Select all the <div> elements.

$("#btn1")

Select all the element with attribute id == “btn1”.

$(".container")

Select all the element with attribute class=”container”.

$("[href=’domainname.com’]")

Select the element with attribute href=”domainname.com”.

$(‘ul li:first’)

Select the first  <li> element of  the first <ul> element.

$(‘ul li:first-child’)

Select the <li> element of every <ul> element.

$(‘h1:first’)

Select the first <h1> element.

$(‘:text’)

Selects all the <input> element with attribute type ==”text”.

$("div span")

Select all the <span> element that are descendants of <div> element.

$("div > span")

Selects all the <span> element that child of the <div> element.

$("a + span")

Select all <span> that comes immediately after <a> element.

$(“p.eq(3)”)

Select the third <p> element. 3 refers to an index.

fields.title: Jquery Events
fields.description:
Events refer to a particular moment at which something has happened. For eg: When you click a signup button on a home page, You have created an Event. These trigger an event handler function that does some task.

Some Examples:

1. clicking submit type button to send the form asynchronously.

2. clicking a button to hide and show a particular element.

3. validating data and showing messages according to it.

 

Type

Event

Explanation

 

.click()

Executes an event handler function to the click event on an element.

 

.dbclick()

Executes an event handler function to the dbclick event on an element.

Mouse

.mouseenter()

Executes an event handler function to the mouseeneter event on an element.

 

.mousedown()

Executes an event handler function to the mousedown event on an element.

 

.toggle()

Executes an event handler function to the toggle event on an element.

 

.hover()

Executes an event handler function to the hover event on an element.

 

.keyup()

Executes an event handler function to the keyup event on an element.

Keyboard

.keydown()

Executes an event handler function to the keydown event on an element.

 

.keypress()

Executes an event handler function to the keypress event on an element.

 

.ready()

Executes an event handler function to the ready event on an element.

Document/Window

.resize()

Executes an event handler function to the mousedown event on an element.

 

.scroll()

Executes an event handler function to the scroll event on an element.

 

.focus()

Executes an event handler function to the focus event on an element.

Form

.submit()

Executes an event handler function to the submit event on an element.

 

.select()

Executes an event handler function to the select event on an element.

 

.change()

Exceutes an event handler function to the change event on an element.
